dt: {bc}to emerge from an egg, chrysalis, or pupa
{bc}to produce (young) from an egg by applying natural or artificial heat

et: Middle English {it}hacchen{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}hecken{/it} to mate
shortdef: to produce young by incubation
to emerge from an egg, chrysalis, or pupa
to give forth young or imagoes

dt: {bc}to inlay with narrow bands of distinguishable material
{bc}to mark (something, such as a drawing or engraving) with fine closely spaced lines

et: Middle French {it}hacher{/it} to chop, slice up, incise with fine lines, from Old French {it}hachier{/it} {ma}{mat|hash|}{/ma}
shortdef: to inlay with narrow bands of distinguishable material
to mark (something, such as a drawing or engraving) with fine closely spaced lines

dt: {bc}a {d_link|mark|mark:1}, {d_link|line|line:1}, or {d_link|stroke|stroke:2} (as in a drawing or engraving) made usually by a single movement of a pen, pencil, etc.
{bc}one made in parallel with others to give the effect of shading

dt.t: Dots, {wi}hatches{/wi}, crosshatches, flowing lines, scribbles—use them all!
I continue to refine and tighten the drawing as I develop the form and color with overlapping {wi}hatches{/wi}.
Scientists have been unable to determine whether the {wi}hatches{/wi} of the lower part of the drawing were done by a right- or left-handed person.
[Adobe] Illustrator's new filters include Ink Pen, for creating organic-looking {wi}hatches{/wi} …

shortdef: a mark, line, or stroke (as in a drawing or engraving) made usually by a single movement of a pen, pencil, etc.; especially : one made in parallel with others to give the effect of shading

dt: {bc}a small door or opening (as in an airplane or spaceship)
{bc}an opening in the deck of a ship or in the floor or roof of a building

et: Middle English {it}hache{/it}, from Old English {it}hæc{/it}; akin to Middle Dutch {it}hecke{/it} trapdoor
shortdef: a small door or opening (as in an airplane or spaceship)
an opening in the deck of a ship or in the floor or roof of a building
the covering for such an opening
an act or instance of hatching
a brood of hatched young

dt: {bc}to grow prosperous especially at the expense of another

et: probably from Old Norse {it}batna{/it} to improve; akin to Old English {it}betera{/it} better
shortdef: to grow fat
to feed gluttonously
to grow prosperous especially at the expense of another —usually used with on

dt: {bc}to fasten with or as if with battens
{bc}to make one secure by or as if by battens
{bc}to prepare for a difficult or dangerous situation

shortdef: to furnish with battens
to fasten with or as if with battens —often used with down
to make one secure by or as if by battens

dt: {bc}a raised framework with a sliding cover over a small hatch on a ship

shortdef: a raised framework with a sliding cover over a small hatch on a ship
a psychiatric hospital —usually used with the

dt: {bc}a hatch providing an emergency exit from an enclosed space
{bc}a means of evading a difficulty, dilemma, or responsibility

a means of evading a difficulty, dilemma, or responsibility
